(I apologize for taking so long to reply. I've had difficulties with a site 
of mine that doesn't want to cooperate *grrrrr*^_^)

Hysteria/Tavatron

Hysteria:

Hysteria dropped to all fours and peered beneath the main console again. It 
had taken her quite a while, but she was almost done. A few more connections 
and the console should be working again:

"That's great Firearm, thanks for the help."

Hysteria rolled onto her back and picked up her small welder. She made a few 
more adjustments and then hit the power switch in the back of the console. 
The console itself flickered to life. It was still a mess, but at least it 
was functional.

*****

Tavatron:

Something about this didn't feel right. The tension in the air was bad 
enough, but Dinobot's attitude wasn't helping either. She knew he didn't 
like being put in a position where he needed to ask for help. Right now, 
however, she doubted he even needed it:

*You're right, he doesn't need you. Not now, not ever.*

Tavatron snarled under her breath. That blasted voice was back! Would it not 
give her a moments peace?! Tavatron shook it off and raised her staff, 
prepared to swing it at the small creature. She swung with a considerable 
amount of force. Not enough to do any serious harm, but enough to remove the 
small animal. Just before her staff reached its destined target *she* 
decided to intervene. The last time she had felt like this her mind had been 
reeling and Dinobot was nearly dead. Dizziness hit her in a wave so intense 
it knocked her staff from her shaking hands. Tavatron grasped her head and 
moaned in pain. She clenched her teeth and breathed slowy in... and out. The 
darkness was returning, and she couldn't fight it. Not again:

*Do you think I'll let you have your way? I'm faster, stronger, and more 
skilled than you will ever be. You, my pathetic counterpart, are weak.*

Tavarton knelt down and wrapped her fingers around the middle of her staff. 
She remained in this position for the time being. Her head was still 
pounding and the dizziness had begun to fade. At least the voice was 
silent... for now.

>For some unexplainable reason Tavatron's sudden apology heightened his 
>aggression and his eyes turned into slits. This was pathetic! Since when 
>had he needed the help of others in a foolish situation such as this? It 
>was...absurd! A grown man such as himself with a history of bloodshed, 
>seeming helpless just because a black ball from Hell landed on his snout! 
>What foolishness!     However, Dinobot remained where he was as Tavatron 
>leaned close and the small creature decided to use her nose as a target, 
>the female jumping back and whimpering quietly in alarm.
>Dinobot only snarled and rolled his eyes, getting sick of the little game, 
>which this creature was deciding to play with the both of them. Thinking 
>and wondering if it had any clue that it would be nothing but stray whips 
>of fuzz on the wind if he ever got his transmetal claws on it. It was 
>already stamped DEAD as far as he was concerned.    Dinobot jerked his head 
>towards Tavatron as she tore her staff from sub-space, wondering if she was 
>going to take some sort of revenge upon the ball-o-fuzz resting comfortably 
>upon his most highly reflective snout. However, was not eager to see if his 
>thoughts were false...or her aim. There was one fact, which Tavatron would 
>have to catch up upon before she so much of moved a metallic muscle, and 
>that was that if she hit him instead of the cat she would have a pair of 
>transmetal fangs to try and pry off of her throat. She was indeed his 
>friend, yes...but no bot hit him and got away with it.
>Dinobot snarled in response to her telling of him to remain still, shaking 
>his head to try and rid himself of the creature before moving it down and 
>reaching towards it with his own claws. If it tried to swat him, he would 
>simply squish it, then peel it off of his snout. Which suited him just as 
>well.**
>
>
